intro: Pectis luckoviae, commonly known as the Karoo pectis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually linear and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow. Pectis luckoviae is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in dry gardens.
